The Elder Upavāna’s Birth Story
“The Victor named Padumuttara,
who had gone to the other side of all things,
like a mass of flames burning,
the Awakened One attained final Nibbāna.
A great crowd gathered,🔽and after worshipping the Realised One,
they built a funeral pyre for the Happy One
and placed the body on it.
After performing the body duties,
they divided the relics there,
and all the gods and humans
made a monument for the Buddha.
The first was made of gold,
and the second of gems;
the third was made of silver,
and the fourth of crystal.
There the fifth was made
of red coral,
and the sixth of ruby,
all on top of precious gems.
The shanks were made of gems,
and the railings were made of precious gems;
the monument was entirely made of gold,
rising a league into the sky.
The gods gathered there
and consulted together then:
‘We too will make a monument
for the Protector of the World, the One of Suchness.
There are no extra relics,
And the body was made into one lump;
In this monument of the Buddha,
What covering shall we make?’

All have made a monument to the Buddha,

We too will make a monument,
for the Lord of the World, the Worthy One.’
